00075   inline void readBoolean( bool* value )
00076   {
00077     checkBufferSize(1);
00078     *value = (*m_buf == 1 ? true : false);

00092   inline void readBytesOnly(uint8_t* buffer, uint32_t len)
00093   {
00094     if (len > 0) {
00095       checkBufferSize(len);
00096       memcpy( buffer, m_buf, len );
00097       m_buf += len;

00130   inline void readBytes( uint8_t** bytes, int32_t* len )
00131   {
00132     int32_t length;
00133     readArrayLen( &length );
00134     *len = length;
00135     uint8_t* buffer = NULL;
00136     if ( length > 0 ) {
00137       checkBufferSize(length);
00138       GF_NEW( buffer, uint8_t[ length ] );
00139       memcpy( buffer, m_buf, length );
00140       m_buf += length;
00141     }
00142     *bytes = buffer;
00143   }

00176   inline void readInt( uint16_t* value )
00177   {
00178     checkBufferSize(2);
00179     uint16_t tmp = *(m_buf++);
00180     tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00181     *value = tmp;
00182   }
00183 
00190   inline void readInt( uint32_t* value )
00191   {
00192     checkBufferSize(4);
00193     uint32_t tmp = *(m_buf++);
00194     tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00195     tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00196     tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00197     *value = tmp;
00198   }
00199 
00206   inline void readInt( uint64_t* value )
00207   {
00208     checkBufferSize(8);
00209     uint64_t tmp;
00210     if ( sizeof( long ) == 8 ) {
00211       tmp = *(m_buf++);
00212       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00213       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00214       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00215       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00216       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00217       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00218       tmp = (tmp << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00219     } else {
00220       uint32_t hword = *(m_buf++);
00221       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00222       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00223       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00224 
00225       tmp = hword;
00226       hword = *(m_buf++);
00227       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00228       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00229       hword = (hword << 8) | *(m_buf++);
00230       tmp = (tmp << 32) | hword;
00231     }
00232     *value = tmp;
00233   }

00279   inline void readArrayLen( int32_t* len )
00280   {
00281     uint8_t code;
00282     read(&code);
00283     if (code == 0xFF) {
00284       *len = -1;
00285     } else {
00286       int32_t result = code;
00287       if (result > 252) {  // 252 is java's ((byte)-4 && 0xFF)
00288         if (code == 0xFE) {
00289           uint16_t val;
00290           readInt(&val);
00291           result = val;
00292         } else if (code == 0xFD) {
00293           uint32_t val;
00294           readInt(&val);
00295           result = val;
00296         } else {
00297           throw IllegalStateException("unexpected array length code");
00298         }
00299       }
00300       *len = result;
00301     }
00302   }
00303 
00310   inline void readUnsignedVL(int64_t * value)
00311   {
00312     int32_t shift = 0;
00313     int64_t result = 0;
00314     while (shift < 64) {
00315       int8_t b;
00316       read(&b);
00317       result |= (int64_t)(b & 0x7F) << shift;
00318       if ((b & 0x80) == 0) {
00319         *value = result;
00320         return;
00321       }
00322       shift += 7;
00323     }
00324     throw IllegalStateException("Malformed variable length integer");
00325   }
00326 
00332   inline void readFloat( float* value )
00333   {
00334     checkBufferSize(4);
00335     union float_uint32_t
00336     {
00337         float f;
00338         uint32_t u;
00339     }v;
00340     readInt( (uint32_t*)&v.u);
00341     *value = v.f;
00342   }
00343 
00350   inline void readDouble( double* value )
00351   {
00352     checkBufferSize(8);
00353     union double_uint64_t
00354     {
00355         double d;
00356         uint64_t        ll;
00357     }v;
00358     readInt( (uint64_t*)&v.ll);
00359     *value = v.d;
00360   }

00397   inline void readASCII( char** value, uint16_t* len = NULL )
00398   {
00399     uint16_t length;
00400     readInt( &length );
00401     checkBufferSize(length);
00402     if ( len != NULL ) {
00403       *len = length;
00404     }
00405     char* str;
00406     GF_NEW( str, char[ length + 1 ] );
00407     *value = str;
00408     readBytesOnly((int8_t*)str, length);
00409     str[ length ] = '\0';
00410   }

00456   inline void readUTF( char** value, uint16_t* len = NULL )
00457   {
00458     uint16_t length;
00459     readInt( &length );
00460     checkBufferSize(length);
00461     uint16_t decodedLen = (uint16_t)getDecodedLength( m_buf, length );
00462     if ( len != NULL ) {
00463       *len = decodedLen;
00464     }
00465     char* str;
00466     GF_NEW( str, char[ decodedLen + 1 ] );
00467     *value = str;
00468     for( uint16_t i = 0; i < decodedLen; i++ ) {
00469       decodeChar( str++ );
00470     }
00471     *str = '\0'; // null terminate for c-string.
00472   }
00473 
00483   inline void readUTFNoLen(wchar_t** value, uint16_t decodedLen)
00484   {
00485     wchar_t* str;
00486     GF_NEW(str, wchar_t[decodedLen + 1]);
00487     *value = str;
00488     for (uint16_t i = 0; i < decodedLen; i++) {
00489       decodeChar(str++);
00490     }
00491     *str = L'\0'; // null terminate for c-string.
00492   }

00508   inline void readUTFHuge( char** value, uint32_t* len = NULL )
00509   {
00510     uint32_t length;
00511     readInt( &length );
00512     if ( len != NULL ) {
00513       *len = length;
00514     }
00515     char* str;
00516     GF_NEW( str, char[ length + 1 ] );
00517     *value = str;
00518     for( uint32_t i = 0; i < length; i++ ) {
00519       int8_t item;
00520       read(&item); // ignore this - should be higher order zero byte
00521       read(&item);
00522       *str = item;
00523       str++;
00524     }
00525     *str = '\0'; // null terminate for c-string.
00526   }

00544   inline void readUTF( wchar_t** value, uint16_t* len = NULL )

00561 
00576   inline void readUTFHuge( wchar_t** value, uint32_t* len = NULL )
00577   {
00578     uint32_t length;
00579     readInt( &length );
00580     if ( len != NULL ) {
00581       *len = length;
00582     }
00583     wchar_t* str;
00584     GF_NEW( str, wchar_t[ length + 1 ] );
00585     *value = str;
00586     for( uint32_t i = 0; i < length; i++ ) {
00587       uint8_t hibyte;
00588       read(&hibyte);
00589       uint8_t lobyte;
00590       read(&lobyte);
00591       *str = (((uint16_t)hibyte) << 8) | (uint16_t)lobyte;
00592       str++;
00593     }
00594     *str = L'\0'; // null terminate for c-string.
00595   }

00616   template< class PTR >
00617   inline void readObject( SharedPtr<PTR>& ptr,
00618       bool throwOnError = DINP_THROWONERROR_DEFAULT )
00619   {
00620     SerializablePtr sPtr;
00621     readObjectInternal( sPtr );
00622     if ( throwOnError ) {
00623       ptr = dynCast< SharedPtr<PTR> >( sPtr );
00624     } else {
00625       ptr = staticCast< SharedPtr<PTR> >( sPtr );
00626     }
00627   }

00649   inline bool readNativeString(CacheableStringPtr& csPtr)
00650   {
00651     int8_t typeId = 0;
00652     read( &typeId );
00653     int64_t compId = typeId;
00654     if (compId == GemfireTypeIds::NullObj) {
00655      csPtr = NULLPTR;
00656     }
00657     else if (compId == GemfireTypeIds::CacheableNullString) {
00658       csPtr = CacheableStringPtr(dynamic_cast<CacheableString *>(CacheableString::createDeserializable()));
00659     }
00660     else if ( compId == gemfire::GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIString) {
00661       csPtr = CacheableStringPtr(dynamic_cast<CacheableString *>(CacheableString::createDeserializable()));
00662       csPtr.ptr()->fromData(*this);
00663     }
00664     else if ( compId == gemfire::GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIStringHuge) {
00665       csPtr = CacheableStringPtr(dynamic_cast<CacheableString *>(CacheableString::createDeserializableHuge()));
00666       csPtr.ptr()->fromData(*this);
00667     }
00668     else if ( compId == gemfire::GemfireTypeIds::CacheableString) {
00669       csPtr = CacheableStringPtr(dynamic_cast<CacheableString *>(CacheableString::createUTFDeserializable()));
00670       csPtr.ptr()->fromData(*this);
00671     }
00672     else if ( compId == gemfire::GemfireTypeIds::CacheableStringHuge) {
00673       csPtr = CacheableStringPtr(dynamic_cast<CacheableString *>(CacheableString::createUTFDeserializableHuge()));
00674       csPtr.ptr()->fromData(*this);
00675     }
00676     else {
00677       LOGDEBUG("In readNativeString something is wrong while expecting string");
00678       rewindCursor(1);
00679       csPtr = NULLPTR;
00680       return false;
00681     }
00682     return true;
00683   }

00733   inline void readCharArray(char** value, int32_t& length){
00734     int arrayLen = 0;
00735     readArrayLen(&arrayLen);
00736     length = arrayLen;
00737     char* objArray = NULL;
00738     if(arrayLen > 0) {
00739     objArray = new char[arrayLen];
00740       int i = 0;
00741       for( i = 0; i < arrayLen; i++ ){
00742         char tmp = 0;
00743         readPdxChar(&tmp);
00744         objArray[i] =  tmp;
00745       }
00746       *value = objArray;
00747     }
00748   }

00782   inline void readString(char** value) {
00783     int8_t typeId;
00784     read(&typeId);
00785 
00786     //Check for NULL String
00787     if (typeId == GemfireTypeIds::CacheableNullString){
00788         *value = NULL;
00789         return;
00790     }
00791     /*
00792     if (typeId == GemfireTypeIds::CacheableString) {
00793       readUTF(value);
00794     } else {
00795       readUTFHuge(value);
00796     }
00797     */
00798     if (typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIString || typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableString) {
00799       readUTF( value);
00800         //m_len = shortLen;
00801     }else if (typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIStringHuge || typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableStringHuge) {
00802       readUTFHuge( value);
00803     }
00804     else {
00805         throw IllegalArgumentException("DI readString error:: String type not supported ");
00806     }
00807 
00808   }
00809 
00810   inline void readWideString(wchar_t** value) {
00811     int8_t typeId;
00812     read(&typeId);
00813 
00814     //Check for NULL String
00815     if (typeId == GemfireTypeIds::CacheableNullString){
00816       *value = NULL;
00817       return;
00818     }
00819 
00820     if (typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIString || typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableString) {
00821       readUTF( value);
00822     }else if (typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableASCIIStringHuge || typeId == (int8_t)GemfireTypeIds::CacheableStringHuge) {
00823       readUTFHuge( value);
00824     }
00825     else {
00826       throw IllegalArgumentException("DI readWideString error:: WideString type provided is not supported ");
00827     }
00828   }

00830   inline void readStringArray(char*** strArray, int32_t& length) {
00831     int32_t arrLen;
00832     readArrayLen(&arrLen);
00833     length = arrLen;
00834     if (arrLen == -1) {
00835       *strArray = NULL;
00836       return;
00837     } else {
00838       char** tmpArray;
00839       GF_NEW( tmpArray, char*[arrLen]);
00840       for (int i = 0; i < arrLen; i++) {
00841         readString(&tmpArray[i]);
00842       }
00843       *strArray = tmpArray;
00844     }
00845   }

00847   inline void readWideStringArray(wchar_t*** strArray, int32_t& length) {
00848     int32_t arrLen;
00849     readArrayLen(&arrLen);
00850     length = arrLen;
00851     if (arrLen == -1) {
00852       *strArray = NULL;
00853       return;
00854     } else {
00855       wchar_t** tmpArray;
00856       GF_NEW( tmpArray, wchar_t*[arrLen]);
00857       for (int i = 0; i < arrLen; i++) {
00858         readWideString(&tmpArray[i]);
00859       }
00860       *strArray = tmpArray;
00861     }
00862   }

00864   inline void readArrayOfByteArrays(int8_t*** arrayofBytearr,
00865     int32_t& arrayLength, int32_t** elementLength) {
00866     int32_t arrLen;
00867     readArrayLen(&arrLen);
00868     arrayLength = arrLen;
00869 
00870     if (arrLen == -1) {
00871       *arrayofBytearr = NULL;
00872       return;
00873     } else {
00874       int8_t** tmpArray;
00875       int32_t* tmpLengtharr;
00876       GF_NEW( tmpArray, int8_t*[arrLen]);
00877       GF_NEW( tmpLengtharr, int32_t[arrLen]);
00878       for (int i = 0; i < arrLen; i++) {
00879         readBytes(&tmpArray[i], &tmpLengtharr[i]);
00880       }
00881       *arrayofBytearr = tmpArray;
00882       *elementLength = tmpLengtharr;
00883     }
00884   }
00885 
00896   static int32_t getDecodedLength( const uint8_t* value, int32_t length )
00897   {
00898     const uint8_t* end = value + length;
00899     int32_t decodedLen = 0;
00900     while ( value < end ) {
00901        // get next byte unsigned
00902     int32_t b = *value++ & 0xff;
00903     int32_t k = b >> 5;
00904     // classify based on the high order 3 bits
00905       switch (  k )
00906         {       
00907         case 6:
00908           {
00909             value++;
00910             break;
00911           }
00912         case 7:
00913           {
00914             value += 2;
00915             break;
00916           }
00917         default:
00918           break;
00919         }
00920       decodedLen += 1;
00921     }
00922     if ( value > end ) decodedLen--;
00923     return decodedLen;
00924   }

00927   DataInput(const uint8_t* m_buffer, int32_t len)
00928     : m_buf(m_buffer), m_bufHead(m_buffer), m_bufLength(len), m_poolName(NULL)
00929   {
00930   }

00940   inline const uint8_t* currentBufferPosition() const
00941   {
00942     return m_buf;
00943   }
00944 
00946   inline int32_t getBytesRead() const
00947   {
00948     return static_cast<int32_t>(m_buf - m_bufHead);
00949   }
00950 
00952   inline int32_t getBytesRemaining() const
00953   {
00954     return (m_bufLength - getBytesRead());
00955   }

00958   inline void advanceCursor(int32_t offset)
00959   {
00960     m_buf += offset;
00961   }
00962 
00964   inline void rewindCursor(int32_t offset)
00965   {
00966     m_buf -= offset;

00970   inline void reset()
00971   {
00972     m_buf = m_bufHead;
00973   }

00975   inline void setBuffer()
00976   {
00977     m_buf = currentBufferPosition();    
00978     m_bufLength = getBytesRemaining();   
00979   }

00982   {
00983     m_buf = m_bufHead + offset;

00985   }
00986 
00987   inline int32_t getPdxBytes() const
00988   {
00989     return m_bufLength;
00990   }
00991 
00992   static uint8_t * getBufferCopy(const uint8_t *from, uint32_t length)
00993   {
00994     uint8_t * result;
00995     GF_NEW( result, uint8_t[ length ] );
00996     memcpy( result, from, length);
00997     
00998     return result;
00999   }
01000 
01001   inline void reset(int32_t offset )
01002   {
01003     m_buf = m_bufHead + offset;
01004   }
01005 
01006   uint8_t * getBufferCopyFrom(const uint8_t *from, uint32_t length)
01007   {
01008     uint8_t * result;
01009     GF_NEW( result, uint8_t[ length ] );
01010     memcpy( result, from, length);
01011     
01012     return result;
01013   }
01014 
01015   /*
01016    * This is for internal use
01017    */
01018   const char* getPoolName()
01019   {
01020     return m_poolName;
01021   }
01022 
01023   /*
01024    * This is for internal use
01025    */
01026   void setPoolName(const char* poolName)
01027   {
01028     m_poolName = poolName;
01029   }
01030 
01031 private:
01032 
01033   const uint8_t* m_buf;
01034   const uint8_t* m_bufHead;
01035   int32_t m_bufLength;
01036   const char* m_poolName;
01037 
01038   void readObjectInternal( SerializablePtr& ptr, int8_t typeId = -1 );
01039 
01040   template <typename mType>
01041   void readObject(mType** value, int32_t& length)
01042   {
01043     int arrayLen;
01044     readArrayLen(&arrayLen);
01045     length = arrayLen;
01046     mType* objArray;
01047     if(arrayLen > 0) {
01048       objArray = new mType[arrayLen];
01049       int i = 0;
01050       for( i = 0; i < arrayLen; i++ ){
01051         mType tmp = 0;
01052         readObject(&tmp);
01053         objArray[i] =  tmp; //*value[i] = tmp;
01054       }
01055       *value = objArray;
01056     }
01057   }
01058 
01059   inline void readPdxChar(char* value){
01060     int16_t val = 0;
01061     readInt(&val);
01062     *value = (char)val;
01063   }
01064 
01065   inline void _checkBufferSize(int32_t size, int32_t line)
01066   {
01067     if ((m_bufLength - (m_buf - m_bufHead)) < size) {
01068       char exMsg[128];
01069       gf_sprintf(exMsg, "DataInput: attempt to read beyond buffer at line %d: "
01070           "available buffer size %d, attempted read of size %d ", line,
01071           m_bufLength - (m_buf - m_bufHead), size);
01072       throw OutOfRangeException(exMsg);
01073     }
01074   }
01075 
01076   inline void decodeChar( char* str )
01077   {
01078     uint8_t bt = *(m_buf++);
01079     if ( bt & 0x80 ) {
01080       if ( bt & 0x20 ) {
01081         // three bytes.
01082         *str = ((bt & 0x0f) << 12) | (((*m_buf++) & 0x3f) << 6);
01083         *str |= ((*m_buf++) & 0x3f);
01084       } else {
01085         // two bytes.
01086         *str = ((bt & 0x1f) << 6) | ((*m_buf++) & 0x3f);
01087       }
01088     } else {
01089       // single byte...
01090       *str = bt;
01091     }
01092   }
01093 
01094   inline void decodeChar( wchar_t* str )
01095   {
01096     // get next byte unsigned
01097     int32_t b = *m_buf++ & 0xff;
01098     int32_t k = b >> 5;
01099     // classify based on the high order 3 bits
01100     switch (  k )
01101       {     
01102       case 6:
01103         {
01104           // two byte encoding
01105           // 110yyyyy 10xxxxxx
01106           // use low order 6 bits
01107           int32_t y = b & 0x1f;
01108           // use low order 6 bits of the next byte
01109           // It should have high order bits 10, which we don't check.
01110           int32_t x = *m_buf++ & 0x3f;
01111           // 00000yyy yyxxxxxx
01112           *str = ( y << 6 | x );
01113           break;
01114         }
01115     case 7:
01116       {
01117         // three byte encoding
01118         // 1110zzzz 10yyyyyy 10xxxxxx
01119         //assert ( b & 0x10 )
01120           //     == 0 : "UTF8Decoder does not handle 32-bit characters";
01121         // use low order 4 bits
01122         int32_t z = b & 0x0f;
01123         // use low order 6 bits of the next byte
01124         // It should have high order bits 10, which we don't check.
01125         int32_t y = *m_buf++ & 0x3f;
01126         // use low order 6 bits of the next byte
01127         // It should have high order bits 10, which we don't check.
01128         int32_t x = *m_buf++ & 0x3f;
01129         // zzzzyyyy yyxxxxxx
01130         int32_t asint = ( z << 12 | y << 6 | x );
01131         *str =  asint;
01132         break;
01133       }
01134        default:
01135         // one byte encoding
01136         // 0xxxxxxx
01137         // use just low order 7 bits
01138         // 00000000 0xxxxxxx
01139         *str = ( b & 0x7f );
01140         break;
01141     }    
01142   }
01143 
01144   // disable other constructors and assignment
01145   DataInput();
01146   DataInput(const DataInput&);
01147   DataInput& operator =(const DataInput&);
01148 };
01149 
01150 }
01151 
01152 #endif // __GEMFIRE_DATAINPUT_H__
GemFire C++ Cache API Documentation
